intro: Neoporteria subaiana, commonly known as the Sierra Madre bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
